text: Suppose I have a strategy that makes around £100 per month, placing £2 bets on UK horse racing on the morning of each race. The strategy is hard to scale. Maybe I can just sell it instead, by publishing the signals at the same time as I execute? I'm not claiming it'll be good value for the punter, but it won't really be worse than anything else out there.

text: You ask the weirdest questions

text: Why does it need to be successful? People sell (and buy) any old shit. Plenty of scammers about. On topic of scammers, Tony Hargraves has some bullshit thing called betjet-pro which has some cloud based thing that automatically places bets for "customers" based off what the "tipster" account does. Sounds utterly nonsensical to my mind but unless you are selling actual selections and a price interval I'd imagine you will end up with all sorts of aggravation from unhappy customers after a down run. Also if it's hard for YOU to scale it how would your customers be able to profit from it? Plus you'll need to declare it to the tax man. Sounds like a world of pain for very little reward - especially after you've put effort into marketing it and establishing an online persona.

elements.text: Why does it need to be successful? People sell (and buy) any old shit. Plenty of scammers about. text: Most tips become worthless (if not worthless already which is most tips tbf) after publishing since executions moved the price beyond fair value. So tipping services are likely to be hard to scale just as much as your own execution.

elements.text: Most tips become worthless (if not worthless already which is most tips tbf) after publishing since executions moved the price beyond fair value. So tipping services are likely to be hard to scale just as much as your own execution.

text:
I'm considering it out of curiosity as much as anything else. Making £100 a month from morning trades is very reasonable for my signal. £1k a month might be pushing it. But from what I've seen, a mug would probably execute an arbitrary portion of provided signals and would therefore have under 100% correlation with me.

Some mugs would win. Some mugs would lose. The winning mugs will be happy. And might encourage others to follow me
